<title level="1" right="Rules">[Companion Items](/Rules.aspx?ID=3209)</title>

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 272 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
You might want to acquire items that benefit a creature that assists you, such as an [animal companion](/Rules.aspx?ID=2113), [familiar](/Rules.aspx?ID=2121), or [bonded animal](/Feats.aspx?ID=5127). These items have the [companion](/Traits.aspx?ID=558) trait, meaning they function only for animal companions, familiars, and similar creatures. Normally, these are the only items a companion can use. Other items can qualify at the GM's discretion, but a companion can never [Activate an Item](/Rules.aspx?ID=3139).

Any worn companion item needs to be invested. However, your companion needs to invest it, rather than you doing so. This requires you to use the [Invest an Item](/Actions.aspx?ID=289) activity alongside your companion, helping them attune to the item and ensuring it is properly fit. A companion has an investiture limit of two items (instead of the 10-item limit a player character has).

[Click here for the Companion Items category page](/Equipment.aspx?Category=41&Subcategory=43).
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
